 [<span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎דָּבַר‎</span>]<sub>1142</sub> **verb** ==speak== (original meaning dubious; ***range in order*** [[BDB#Thes|Thes]] is conjectural and not comprehensive enough; ***treiben*** [[BDB#MV|MV]] does not explain Arabic or Hebrew usage, but only Aramaic [[BDB#A|A]] meaning ***go away***, sustained by Arabic <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhNQAcAIAAAP///wAAACH5BAAAAAAALAAAAAA1ABwAAAJ6hI+py+0Po5wUhBuqhhivvG1e0oHIGFIduabugb5yZM5vbFy3hlt6+jvVFEHhUFX0HXNJ5nLS7JU+T0nTx2ISr4wjt1jShaFhVA3sKVepZWPP5oRtW0jr8rxWUu1zGj3LEcXFkuc3CBd4OPMGw7j4x4bY9+AoaXl5WQAAOw=="> ***go away with it***, would best explain the four branches of usage: — (1) Arabic <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhIAAbAIAAAP///wAAACH5BAAAAAAALAAAAAAgABsAAAJOhI+py93hIgjwUJpuvHhy+zmhlWlSJaXqyrYrCrqICcItbYxuV8qkgmMEeTObEIPscIIPSLLIfPhExmkMWE1FiS+u1ZOV6abL8O2LTk8LADs="> ***depart, perish***, IV. ***retreat***, figurative ***retrograde, decline***; <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhIQAaAIAAAP///wAAACH5BAAAAAAALAAAAAAhABoAAAJYhI+py80RnAQwwWrjvJgazGlNdHnfR5ZbKlLk9HAZPLb0jedKd/C6a1P9gBlfziiD2U4LY9PndCkrLFEoWrwitFPUU7hqDlFLMM5M/iXH2/X4ij272XRHAQA7"> ***passing away, death***; Assyrian <abbr title="transliteration"><u>***dabâru***</u></abbr>, Pi\`el ***drive away***, [[BDB#Bez|Bez]]<sup>Orient. **3.** ***with persons:*** 
$\quad$ $\quad$ **a.** rarely accusative <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎יָָֽכְלוּ דַבְּרוֺ לְשָׁלֹם‎</span> ***they could*** [***not***] ***speak unto him peaceably*** [[Gen.37.4|Gen 37:4]] ([[BDB#J|J]]; but [[BDB#Ew|Ew]]<sup>§ 282 a</sup> ***about him***); <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וַיְדַבֵּר ֗֗֗ אֹתָם‎</span> [[Num.26.3|Num 26:3]] ([[BDB#P|P]], but text corrupt see [[BDB#Di|Di]]; not satisfactory explanation yet given, possibly read <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אִתָּם‎</span> see **d**). 
$\quad$ $\quad$ **b.** most frequently with <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אֶל‎</span> throughout the literature: [[Gen.8.15|Gen 8:15]] +; compare phrases <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אֶל משֶׁה לֵאמֹר‎</span> <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וַיְדַבֵּר י‎</span> [[Exod.6.10|Exod 6:10]] + 87 t. [[BDB#P|P]]; but <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אל משׁה לך‎</span> <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וידבּר י‎</span> [[Exod.32.7|Exod 32:7]]; [[Exod.33.1|Exod 33:1]] ([[BDB#J|J]][[BDB#E|E]]); <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎דבּר אל אהרן‎</span> [[Lev.6.18|Lev 6:18]] + 8 t. ([[BDB#P|P]]); <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎ישׂראל דבר אל בני‎</span> [[Exod.6.9|Exod 6:9]] + 38 t. ([[BDB#P|P]]); elsewhere, [[Exod.19.6|Exod 19:6]] ([[BDB#E|E]]) [[Deut.1.3|Deut 1:3]]; [[Deut.4.45|Deut 4:45]] ([[BDB#D|D]]); <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אל (כל) העדה‎</span> <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎ד‎</span> [[Exod.12.3|Exod 12:3]]; [[Lev.19.2|Lev 19:2]]; [[Num.16.24|Num 16:24]]; [[Num.16.26|Num 16:26]] ([[BDB#P|P]]); <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אל לב‎</span> <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎ד‎</span> ***speak unto one's heart*** [[Gen.24.45|Gen 24:45]], i.e. to oneself, compare also <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎על לִבָּהּ‎</span> <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎ד‎</span> [[1Sam.1.13|1Sam 1:13]], see **5** below; <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אל‎</span> is used inexactly for <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎על‎</span> [[1Sam.3.12|1Sam 3:12]]; [[1Kgs.16.12|1Kgs 16:12]]; [[Isa.16.13|Isa 16:13]]; [[Jer.27.13|Jer 27:13]]; [[Jer.30.4|Jer 30:4]]; [[Jer.33.14|Jer 33:14]]; [[Jer.36.7|Jer 36:7]]; [[Jer.36.31|Jer 36:31]]; [[Jer.40.2|Jer 40:2]]; [[Jer.50.1|Jer 50:1]]; [[Jer.51.12|Jer 51:12]]; [[Jer.51.62|Jer 51:62]] where it is rendered ***concerning*** or ***against.*** 
$\quad$ $\quad$ **c.** with <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎לְ‎</span> ***speak to*** [[1Kgs.2.19|1Kgs 2:19]]; [[Ezek.32.21|Ezek 32:21]]; [[Dan.2.4|Dan 2:4]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎ליהוה‎</span> ***speak, sing to Yahweh*** words of a song [[Josh.10.12|Josh 10:12]] ([[BDB#D|D]]) [[2Sam.22.1|2Sam 22:1]] (= [[Ps.18.1|Ps 18:1]] title); in [[BDB#D|D]], <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎דבר ל‎</span> ***promise to***, in phrases <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎) ל‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎כאשׁר דבר(י‎</span> [[Deut.1.11|Deut 1:11]]; [[Deut.1.21|Deut 1:21]]; [[Deut.6.3|Deut 6:3]]; [[Deut.9.3|Deut 9:3]]; [[Deut.10.9|Deut 10:9]]; [[Deut.11.25|Deut 11:25]]; [[Deut.12.20|Deut 12:20]]; [[Deut.15.6|Deut 15:6]]; [[Deut.18.2|Deut 18:2]]; [[Deut.26.18|Deut 26:18]]; [[Deut.27.3|Deut 27:3]]; [[Deut.29.12|Deut 29:12]]; [[Josh.13.14|Josh 13:14]]; [[Josh.13.33|Josh 13:33]]; [[Josh.22.4|Josh 22:4]]; [[Josh.23.5|Josh 23:5]]; [[Josh.23.10|Josh 23:10]] (all [[BDB#D|D]]); <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אשׁר דבר ל‎</span> [[Deut.9.28|Deut 9:28]]; [[1Kgs.8.24|1Kgs 8:24]]; [[1Kgs.8.25|1Kgs 8:25]]; [[1Kgs.8.26|1Kgs 8:26]] (= [[2Chr.6.15|2Chr 6:15]]; [[2Chr.6.16|2Chr 6:16]]; [[2Chr.6.17|2Chr 6:17]]). — <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎דבר ל‎</span> [[Gen.24.7|Gen 24:7]]; [[Gen.28.15|Gen 28:15]]; [[Gen.49.28|Gen 49:28]]; [[Exod.32.34|Exod 32:34]] ([[BDB#J|J]]) [[Josh.9.21|Josh 9:21]] ([[BDB#P|P]]) [[Judg.14.7|Judg 14:7]]; [[2Sam.23.3|2Sam 23:3]]; [[Isa.30.10|Isa 30:10]]; [[Zech.9.10|Zech 9:10]] usually rendered ***speak to***, but often rather ***promise to.*** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎הֲיֵשׁ לְדַבֶּרלָֿךְ אֶלהַֿמֶּלֶךְ‎</span> ***is it possible to speak for thee unto the king ?*** [[2Kgs.4.13|2Kgs 4:13]] (by attraction to <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎לַעֲשׂוֺת לָךְ‎</span>). 
$\quad$ $\quad$ **d.** with <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אֵת‎</span> ***speak with*** [[Gen.17.3|Gen 17:3]]; [[Gen.17.22|Gen 17:22]]; [[Gen.17.23|Gen 17:23]]; [[Gen.21.2|Gen 21:2]]; [[Gen.23.8|Gen 23:8]]; [[Gen.34.6|Gen 34:6]]; [[Gen.34.8|Gen 34:8]]; [[Gen.35.13|Gen 35:13]]; [[Gen.35.15|Gen 35:15]]; [[Exod.25.22|Exod 25:22]]; [[Exod.31.18|Exod 31:18]]; [[Exod.34.29|Exod 34:29]]; [[Exod.34.33|Exod 34:33]]; [[Exod.34.34|Exod 34:34]]; [[Exod.34.35|Exod 34:35]]; [[Num.3.1|Num 3:1]]; [[Num.7.89|Num 7:89]]; [[Josh.22.15|Josh 22:15]]; [[Josh.22.21|Josh 22:21]] (all [[BDB#P|P]]) [[Gen.35.14|Gen 35:14]]; [[Gen.41.9|Gen 41:9]]; [[Gen.42.7|Gen 42:7]]; [[Gen.45.15|Gen 45:15]]; [[Josh.17.14|Josh 17:14]] (all [[BDB#E|E]]) [[Deut.5.21|Deut 5:21]] sources of Samuel Kings Chronicles, [[2Sam.3.27|2Sam 3:27]]; [[2Sam.7.7|2Sam 7:7]] = [[1Chr.17.6|1Chr 17:6]]; [[1Kgs.8.15|1Kgs 8:15]] = [[2Chr.6.4|2Chr 6:4]]; [[1Kgs.22.24|1Kgs 22:24]] = [[2Chr.18.23|2Chr 18:23]]; [[2Chr.10.10|2Chr 10:10]] ( = <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אל‎</span> [[1Kgs.12.10|1Kgs 12:10]]) [[Jer.5.5|Jer 5:5]]; [[Jer.7.22|Jer 7:22]]; [[Jer.9.7|Jer 9:7]]; [[Jer.35.2|Jer 35:2]]; [[Jer.38.25|Jer 38:25]];  [[Jer.3.22|Jer 3:22]]; [[Jer.3.24|Jer 3:24]]; [[Jer.3.27|Jer 3:27]]; [[Jer.14.4|Jer 14:4]]; [[Jer.20.3|Jer 20:3]]; [[Jer.44.5|Jer 44:5]];   compare phrases <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎דבר חד את אחד‎</span> ***speak one with another*** [[Ezek.33.30|Ezek 33:30]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎דבר משׁפטים את‎</span> ***speak judgments with***, usually = ***give judgment against***, (not [[Jer.12.1|Jer 12:1]]), [[Jer.1.16|Jer 1:16]]; [[Jer.4.12|Jer 4:12]]; [[Jer.12.1|Jer 12:1]]; [[Jer.39.5|Jer 39:5]]; [[Jer.52.9|Jer 52:9]] (= [[2Kgs.25.6|2Kgs 25:6]]); <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎דבר טבות את‎</span> ***speak kindly with*** [[2Kgs.25.28|2Kgs 25:28]] = [[Jer.52.32|Jer 52:32]]. 
$\quad$ $\quad$ **e.** with <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עִם‎</span> ***speak with***, (not [[BDB#P|P]]), [[Gen.29.9|Gen 29:9]]; [[Gen.31.24|Gen 31:24]]; [[Gen.31.29|Gen 31:29]]; [[Exod.19.9|Exod 19:9]]; [[Exod.20.19|Exod 20:19]] (twice in verse); [[Exod.20.22|Exod 20:22]]; [[Exod.33.9|Exod 33:9]]; [[Num.11.17|Num 11:17]]; [[Num.22.19|Num 22:19]]; [[Josh.24.27|Josh 24:27]] (all [[BDB#J|J]] [[BDB#E|E]]) [[Deut.5.4|Deut 5:4]]; [[Deut.9.10|Deut 9:10]]; [[Judg.6.17|Judg 6:17]]; [[1Sam.9.25|1Sam 9:25]] ([[BDB#Sept|ᵐ5]] [[BDB#The|Th]] [[BDB#We|We]] [[BDB#Dr|Dr]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וַיִּרְבְּדוּ לְ‎</span> ***spread a couch for***) [[1Sam.17.23|1Sam 17:23]]; [[2Sam.13.22|2Sam 13:22]]; [[1Kgs.1.14|1Kgs 1:14]]; [[1Kgs.1.22|1Kgs 1:22]]; [[2Kgs.6.33|2Kgs 6:33]]; [[2Kgs.18.26|2Kgs 18:26]]; [[2Chr.9.1|2Chr 9:1]] (= <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אֶל‎</span> [[1Kgs.10.2|1Kgs 10:2]]) [[Neh.9.18|Neh 9:18]]; [[Esth.6.14|Esth 6:14]]; [[Jer.32.4|Jer 32:4]]; [[Dan.8.18|Dan 8:18]]; [[Dan.9.22|Dan 9:22]]; [[Dan.10.11|Dan 10:11]]; [[Dan.10.15|Dan 10:15]]; [[Dan.10.17|Dan 10:17]]; [[Dan.10.19|Dan 10:19]]; [[Hos.12.5|Hos 12:5]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎דִּבַּרְתִּי אֲנִי עִם לִבִּי‎</span> ***I spake, communed with my heart*** [[Eccl.1.16|Eccl 1:16]]. **feminine** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎לִפְנֵי‎</span> ***before, in the presence of*** [[Exod.6.12|Exod 6:12]]; [[Num.36.1|Num 36:1]] ([[BDB#P|P]]) [[Judg.11.11|Judg 11:11]]; [[1Kgs.3.22|1Kgs 3:22]]; [[Esth.8.3|Esth 8:3]]. 

**4.** with <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎בְּ‎</span> 
$\quad$ $\quad$ **a.** ***instrumental***, <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎דבר בְּ‎</span> ***speak with, by***, or ***by means of a person*** (see above **Qal** near the end) [[Num.12.2|Num 12:2]] (twice in verse); [[Num.12.6|Num 12:6]]; [[Num.12.8|Num 12:8]] ([[BDB#E|E]]) [[2Sam.23.2|2Sam 23:2]] (compare [[BDB#Dr|Dr]]), [[1Kgs.22.28|1Kgs 22:28]] = [[2Chr.18.27|2Chr 18:27]]; [[Hab.2.1|Hab 2:1]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎בְּשֵׁם דִּבֶּר‎</span> ***speak in the name of*** [[Exod.5.23|Exod 5:23]] ([[BDB#J|J]]) [[Deut.18.19|Deut 18:19]]; [[Deut.18.20|Deut 18:20]] (twice in verse); [[Deut.18.22|Deut 18:22]]; [[1Chr.21.19|1Chr 21:19]]; [[Jer.20.9|Jer 20:9]]; [[Jer.26.16|Jer 26:16]]; [[Jer.29.23|Jer 29:23]]; [[Jer.44.16|Jer 44:16]]; [[Dan.9.6|Dan 9:6]]; [[Zech.13.3|Zech 13:3]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎ביד‎</span> ***by the hand of*** [[Num.17.5|Num 17:5]]; [[Num.27.23|Num 27:23]];  ([[BDB#P|P]]) [[1Sam.28.17|1Sam 28:17]]; [[1Kgs.8.53|1Kgs 8:53]] + 13 t. Kings, [[2Chr.10.15|2Chr 10:15]] (= [[1Kgs.12.15|1Kgs 12:15]]) [[Isa.20.2|Isa 20:2]]; [[Jer.37.2|Jer 37:2]]; [[Jer.50.1|Jer 50:1]]; [[Ezek.38.17|Ezek 38:17]]. 
$\quad$ $\quad$ **b.** ***local*** (figurative), <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎בְּאָזְנֵי‎</span> ***in the ears of*** [[Gen.20.8|Gen 20:8]] ([[BDB#E|E]]) [[Exod.11.2|Exod 11:2]]; [[Deut.32.44|Deut 32:44]] ([[BDB#J|J]]) [[Gen.23.16|Gen 23:16]]; [[Num.14.28|Num 14:28]]; [[Josh.20.4|Josh 20:4]] ([[BDB#P|P]]) [[Deut.31.28|Deut 31:28]]; [[Deut.31.30|Deut 31:30]]; [[Judg.9.2|Judg 9:2]]; [[Judg.9.3|Judg 9:3]]; [[1Sam.8.21|1Sam 8:21]]; [[1Sam.11.4|1Sam 11:4]]; [[1Sam.25.24|1Sam 25:24]]; [[2Sam.3.19|2Sam 3:19]] (twice in verse); [[Jer.26.15|Jer 26:15]]; [[Prov.23.9|Prov 23:9]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎בלב דבר‎</span> ***speak in the heart*** [[Eccl.2.15|Eccl 2:15]]. 
$\quad$ $\quad$ **c.** ***of the object, speak of, about*** (preposition <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎בְּ‎</span> **IV. e** [[BDB#Ew|Ew]]<sup>§ 217 f</sup>, (2)) [[Deut.6.7|Deut 6:7]]; [[Deut.11.19|Deut 11:19]]; [[1Sam.19.3|1Sam 19:3]]; [[1Sam.19.4|1Sam 19:4]]; [[Ps.119.46|Ps 119:46]]; [[Ps.122.8|Ps 122:8]] ***propose for*** (a wife) [[1Sam.25.39|1Sam 25:39]] (compare [[Song.8.8|Song 8:8]]). 
$\quad$ $\quad$ **d.** ***of hostility, against*** ([[BDB#Ew|Ew]]<sup>§ 217 f</sup>, (1)) [[Num.12.1|Num 12:1]]; [[Num.12.8|Num 12:8]]; [[Num.21.5|Num 21:5]]; [[Num.21.7|Num 21:7]] ([[BDB#E|E]]) [[Job.19.18|Job 19:18]]; [[Ps.50.20|Ps 50:20]]; [[Ps.78.19|Ps 78:19]]. 
$\quad$ $\quad$ **e.** ***of price***, <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎בְּנַפְשׁוֺ‎</span> ***at the cost of his life*** [[1Kgs.2.23|1Kgs 2:23]] (see  <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎בְּ‎</span> **III. 3**). 

**5.** with <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עַל‎</span>, of the object ***concerning*** or ***about which*** one speaks [[Gen.18.19|Gen 18:19]]; [[Num.10.29|Num 10:29]] ([[BDB#J|J]]) [[Josh.23.14|Josh 23:14]] ([[BDB#D|D]]) [[Judg.9.3|Judg 9:3]]; [[1Sam.25.30|1Sam 25:30]]; [[1Kgs.2.4|1Kgs 2:4]]; [[1Kgs.2.27|1Kgs 2:27]]; [[1Kgs.5.13|1Kgs 5:13]] (twice in verse); [[1Kgs.14.2|1Kgs 14:2]]; [[1Kgs.22.23|1Kgs 22:23]] (= [[2Chr.18.22|2Chr 18:22]]), [[2Kgs.10.10|2Kgs 10:10]]; [[2Kgs.19.21|2Kgs 19:21]] = [[Isa.37.22|Isa 37:22]]; [[1Chr.22.11|1Chr 22:11]]; [[2Chr.23.3|2Chr 23:3]]; [[Jer.1.16|Jer 1:16]]; [[Jer.18.7|Jer 18:7]]; [[Jer.18.8|Jer 18:8]]; [[Jer.18.9|Jer 18:9]]; [[Jer.42.19|Jer 42:19]]. It may have this sense in most if not all of the following, where [[BDB#RV|RV]] renders [[1Kgs.2.18|1Kgs 2:18]]; [[1Kgs.2.19|1Kgs 2:19]]; [[Esth.7.9|Esth 7:9]]; [[Jer.18.20|Jer 18:20]] ***for***; [[2Chr.32.16|2Chr 32:16]]; [[Neh.6.12|Neh 6:12]]; [[Jer.11.17|Jer 11:17]]; [[Jer.16.10|Jer 16:10]]; [[Jer.25.13|Jer 25:13]]; [[Jer.26.13|Jer 26:13]]; [[Jer.26.19|Jer 26:19]]; [[Jer.35.17|Jer 35:17]]; [[Ezek.36.5|Ezek 36:5]]; [[Dan.9.12|Dan 9:12]]; [[Dan.11.36|Dan 11:36]]; [[Hos.7.13|Hos 7:13]]; [[Amos.3.1|Amos 3:1]] ***against***; and [[1Kgs.9.5|1Kgs 9:5]]; [[2Kgs.22.19|2Kgs 22:19]]; [[Jer.10.1|Jer 10:1]]; [[Jer.19.15|Jer 19:15]] ***unto*** (<span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎על‎</span> is used for <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אל‎</span> ***unto*** [[2Chr.32.19|2Chr 32:19]]; [[Jer.6.10|Jer 6:10]]; [[Jer.25.2|Jer 25:2]]; [[Jer.26.2|Jer 26:2]]; [[Hos.12.11|Hos 12:11]]); compare the phrase <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎דבר על לב‎</span> ***speak upon the heart, speak kindly, comfort*** [[Gen.34.3|Gen 34:3]]; [[Gen.50.21|Gen 50:21]] ([[BDB#E|E]]) [[Judg.19.3|Judg 19:3]]; [[Ruth.2.13|Ruth 2:13]]; [[1Sam.1.13|1Sam 1:13]] (seemingly from context <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎על‎</span> for <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אל‎</span>, ***to her heart, to herself***, see [[BDB#Dr|Dr]]), [[2Sam.19.8|2Sam 19:8]]; [[2Chr.30.22|2Chr 30:22]]; [[2Chr.32.6|2Chr 32:6]]; [[Isa.40.2|Isa 40:2]]; [[Hos.2.16|Hos 2:16]]. 

**6.** with infin. <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎דבר לעשׂות‎</span> ***promise to do*** [[Exod.32.14|Exod 32:14]] ([[BDB#J|J]]) [[Deut.1.14|Deut 1:14]]; [[Ezek.6.10|Ezek 6:10]]; [[Jonah.3.10|Jonah 3:10]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎דבר לתת‎</span> ***promise to give*** [[Deut.19.8|Deut 19:8]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎דבר למחות‎</span> ***threaten to blot out*** [[2Kgs.14.27|2Kgs 14:27]] compare <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎דבר להזהיר‎</span> i.e. so as to warn [[Ezek.3.18|Ezek 3:18]]; [[Ezek.33.8|Ezek 33:8]].


**Note.** — <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וַתָּקָם וַתְּדַבֵּר אֶתכָּֿלזֶֿרַע הַמַּמְלָכָה‎</span> [[2Chr.22.10|2Chr 22:10]] [[BDB#Sept|ᵐ5]] <span class="bdbLangGreek">ἀπώλεσε</span>, [[BDB#Vg|ᵑ9]] ***interfecit***, scribal error for <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וַתְּאַבֵּד‎</span> [[2Kgs.11.1|2Kgs 11:1]]. Other explanations: ***plot against, waylay*** (Arabic <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,">) [[BDB#Thes|Thes]] [[BDB#MV|MV]]; ***pronounce sentence***, elliptical <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וַתְּדַבֵּר מִשְׁפָּטִים‎</span> [[BDB#Ges|Ges]]<sup>Hdw</sup> [[BDB#Rob|Rob]]; but compare [[BDB#VB|VB]]. — 

**Pu\`al** ***Imperfect*** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎בַּיּוֺם שֶׁיְּדֻבַּרבָּֿהּ‎</span> ***in the day when she may be spoken for*** [[Song.8.8|Song 8:8]] (see **Pi\`el 4 c**); ***Participle*** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נִכְבָּדוֺת מְדֻבָּר בָּךְ‎</span> ***glorious things are being spoken in thee*** ([[BDB#RV|RV]] [[BDB#Pe|Pe]] [[BDB#MV|MV]] ***of thee***) [[Ps.87.3|Ps 87:3]]. **Hithpa\`el** ***Participle*** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מִדַּבֵּר‎</span> = <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מִתְדַּבֵּר‎</span> with accusative <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מִדַּבֵּר הַדָּבָר הַזֶּה‎</span> ***speaking this word*** [[2Sam.14.13|2Sam 14:13]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎שָׁמַע (אֵת הַקּוֺל) מִדַּבֵּר אֶל‎</span> ***heard*** (***the voice***, or) ***one speaking unto*** [[Num.7.89|Num 7:89]] ([[BDB#P|P]]) [[Ezek.2.2|Ezek 2:2]]; [[Ezek.43.6|Ezek 43:6]] ([[BDB#Di|Di]] [[Num.7.89|Num 7:89]] would read <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מְדַבֵּר‎</span> after [[BDB#Sept|ᵐ5]]; the meaning not appreciably different from Piel; the Hithpa\`el difficult to reconcile with <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אֶל‎</span>). **Hiph\`il** ***Imperfect*** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וַיַּדְבֵּר עַמִּים תַּחְתָּי‎</span> [[Ps.18.48|Ps 18:48]] ([[2Sam.22.48|2Sam 22:48]] has <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וּמֹרִיד‎</span> for rare <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וַיַּדְבֵּר‎</span>), <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎יַדְבֵּר עַמִּים תַּחְתֵּינוּ‎</span> [[Ps.47.4|Ps 47:4]] either (compare Aramaic <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎דַּבַּר‎</span>) ***leads*** subject (so [[BDB#Ges|Ges]] ***coegit***, [[BDB#De|De]] [[BDB#Now|Now]]), or (compare Arabic <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhLAAiAIAAAP///wAAACH5BAAAAAAALAAAAAAsACIAAAJ8hI+py+0Po5wr2EAzuld7gHGfx2FjJp6OtZXqwRppaZ4uaNZqh895rZPQekEirAi5PWIy5HLnfK2Y0givWlFQbcVrs+rtJbZcLZW8RIMqTHUj/GUfUTRl7Opm1FNNvoxu5fc3AQeDdRRVOCI4FkWneFh3yKY0aXmJmdlQAAA7"> ***turn the back, retreat***) ***puts to flight***, figurative for ***subdues*** (so [[BDB#Hi|Hi]]).
